intro: Acetosella stellata, commonly known as star sally, is a low-growing, herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically has a mat-forming growth habit, with hairy stems and small, oval-shaped leaves. Its flowers are pink or white, often with five petals, and bloom in early spring. Acetosella stellata thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and rocky areas.
